skill.name: subagent-driven-development
skill.description: Use when executing implementation plans with independent tasks in the current session
skill.summary: Use when executing implementation plans with independent tasks in the current session
skill.author: obra

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation. No executable code, filesystem access, network calls, environment variable access, or external command execution. The skill provides workflow guidance and AI prompt templates for subagent-driven development.

content.value_statement: Complex implementation plans require structured execution and quality verification. This skill guides AI subagents through tasks with automated spec compliance and code quality reviews, catching issues early before they compound.
actual_capabilities: Dispatch fresh AI subagents for each implementation task
Run spec compliance reviews before code quality checks
Enforce two-stage verification (spec then quality) per task
Guide subagents through self-review before reporting
Track task completion with TodoWrite integration
limitations: Does not execute code or run tests itself
Does not modify project files directly
Subagents must be dispatched by an AI assistant

use_cases.title: Execute implementation plans
use_cases.description: Transform written plans into completed code using AI subagents with quality gates

use_cases.title: Automated code verification
use_cases.description: Ensure every task meets spec compliance before quality review for consistent standards

use_cases.title: Quality-controlled development
use_cases.description: Guide AI assistants through structured workflows that catch issues early and often

prompt_templates.title: Implement task
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement Task N: [task name] using provided specifications and context. Ask questions before beginning if requirements are unclear.

prompt_templates.title: Review spec compliance
prompt_templates.prompt: Review code against requirements. Check for missing features, extra work, and misunderstandings. Read actual code, do not trust reports.

prompt_templates.title: Review code quality
prompt_templates.prompt: Evaluate code for strengths, critical issues, important issues, and minor issues. Focus on testing, maintainability, and cleanliness.

prompt_templates.title: Complete development
prompt_templates.prompt: Run final review across all completed tasks. Prepare branch for merge using superpowers:finishing-a-development-branch.

output_examples.input: Execute this implementation plan for the new authentication feature
output: âœ“ Task 1: User login flow - completed and reviewed
âœ“ Task 2: Session management - completed and reviewed
âœ“ Task 3: Password reset - completed and reviewed
âœ“ Final review passed - ready for merge

best_practices: Provide complete task context upfront to avoid mid-task questions
Never skip spec compliance review before code quality review
Require re-review after implementer fixes issues found by reviewers
anti_patterns: Skipping reviews because subagent reports completion
Starting code quality review before spec compliance passes
Accepting "close enough" spec compliance from reviewers

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Claude, Codex, and Claude Code support subagent dispatching and Task tool usage.

faq.question: What happens if a subagent asks questions?
faq.answer: Answer questions completely before letting the subagent proceed. Never rush implementation.

faq.question: How does this differ from parallel sessions?
faq.answer: This keeps all work in one session with fresh context per task. Parallel sessions create separate contexts.

faq.question: Is user data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. This skill only provides prompts. All code and data stay in your local environment.

faq.question: What if a reviewer finds issues?
faq.answer: Same implementer subagent fixes issues, then reviewer re-reviews. Do not skip re-review.

faq.question: Can this replace human code review?
faq.answer: No. This provides AI-assisted checks. Final review by humans is still recommended for critical code.
